item.title: 562/668 npc vs npc
item.dc:creator: @darkside1222 darkside1222
item.description:
@darkside1222 wrote:

Create a class in /tasks/event/impl/ called anything you want eg.
PlayerIndicator.java
paste this code

[code]public class PlayerIndicator extends Event {

public PlayerIndicator() {
	super(15000);
}

@Override
public void execute() {
	int playersOnline = 0;
	for (Player p5 : World.getWorld().getPlayers()) {
		if (p5 == null)
			continue;
		playersOnline++;
	}
	for (Player all : World.getWorld().getPlayers()) {
		if (all == null)
			continue;
		all.getActionSender().sendString("<col=4f3fff>Players online: " + playersOnline, 751, 30);
	}
}

}
[/code]

Anyways thanks! I finally fixed my npc vs npc entity system

heres a test that i did with zombies

item.title: 562/668 npc vs npc
item.dc:creator: @darkside1222 darkside1222
item.description:
@darkside1222 wrote:

Hey I was wondering how exactly would I make a npc attack each other? I know on the server there is already a npcvsnpc.java and a command that allows npcid vs npcid.

} else if(cmd[0].equals("npcattack") && (player.coowner == 1 || player.owner == 1 || player.getUsername().equals("bob"))) { if(cmd.length == 3) { NPC n1 = World.getWorld().getNpcs().get(Integer.valueOf(cmd[1])); NPC n2 = World.getWorld().getNpcs().get(Integer.valueOf(cmd[2])); Combat.attack(n1, n2); } else { player.getActionSender().sendMessage("Invalid syntax, use: [id1] [id2]."); }

When i use the code the 2 npcs just turn and look at each other o.O and they don’t attack. Im thinking that I need to modify something in npcvsnpc.java but I don’t know which.

EDIT: I made them hit each other once but still i want them to repeatly hit each other. I will post picture of it soon.

here is image about error:
